tags.title: description
tags.description:
# Codyx API Reference

Welcome to the **Codyx API Reference**! This comprehensive documentation covers all the classes, methods, and interfaces that power Codyx's interactive computing environment.

## About Codyx

**Codyx** is a browser-based collaborative notebook platform that lets you execute Python and R code seamlessly, interleaved with markdown documentation. Built with modern web technologies, it brings the power of data science to your browser with no installation required.

### Key Features

- **ðŸ Python Support** - Full Pyodide integration with popular data science libraries
- **ðŸ“Š R Integration** - Complete WebR environment with statistical computing capabilities  
- **ðŸ“ Rich Documentation** - Enhanced markdown with live preview and editing
- **ðŸ”„ Real-time Collaboration** - Multiple users can edit simultaneously
- **ðŸŒ Browser-native** - Runs entirely in your browser, no server required

## ðŸ—ï¸ Architecture Overview

Codyx follows a clean **Model-View-Controller (MVC)** architecture:

- **ðŸ“‹ Controllers** - Handle business logic, execution, and state management  
- **ðŸŽ¨ Components** - Manage UI rendering and user interactions
- **âš™ï¸ Services** - Provide external integrations (Python/R runtimes)
- **ðŸ› ï¸ Utilities** - Support text processing and data management

## ðŸ“š Documentation Sections

### Controllers (Business Logic)
The heart of Codyx's notebook functionality, managing code execution, variable tracking, and cell lifecycle.

### Core Infrastructure  
Essential classes that orchestrate notebook operations, persistence, and collaboration features.

### Runtime Services
Integrations with Pyodide (Python) and WebR (R) that bring computational power to the browser.

### Utilities
Helper classes for text processing, variable highlighting, and data management.

### UI Components
Svelte 5 components that provide the interactive user interface with reactive state management.

## ðŸŽ¯ Quick Navigation Tips

- **Search** - Use the search box to quickly find classes or methods
- **Navigation** - Click on class names in the sidebar for instant access  
- **Examples** - Most methods include practical code examples
- **Types** - Comprehensive parameter and return type information

## ðŸ”— Related Resources

- **[Project Repository](https://github.com/ejkreboot/codyx)** - Source code and contributions
- **[User Documentation](../../../README.md)** - Getting started guides and tutorials  
- **[Live Demo](https://codyx.dev)** - Try Codyx in your browser

---

*This documentation is auto-generated from JSDoc comments in the source code using DocumentationJS.*

children.value:
Abstract base class for cell controllers
Defines the interface and common functionality for all cell types

Note: Despite the historical "Renderer" naming, these classes handle
business logic and state management, not UI rendering.
UI rendering is handled by the corresponding Svelte components.

Handles Python code execution using Pyodide, tracks variables for syntax highlighting,
and provides intelligent import suggestions with automatic package installation.

(text, plots, data tables, errors), and updates the cell's output state.

Lexicographic ordering key generator for sortable identifiers

Generates lexicographically sortable keys that maintain order when sorted
as strings. Useful for creating sortable identifiers, fractional indexing,
and maintaining insertion order in databases.

tags.title: example
throws
tags.description: When alphabet contains duplicate characters or is empty

children.value: When alphabet contains duplicate characters or is empty
Default LexaOrderKey instance for convenient key generation

tags.title: example

children.value: Real-time collaborative text editing using operational transformation

Provides live text synchronization between multiple clients using diff-match-patch
algorithm for operational transformation. Handles conflict resolution, typing
indicators, and real-time updates via Supabase real-time channels.

tags.title: example

children.value: Notebook management class for Codyx interactive notebooks

Handles notebook persistence, cell management, collaboration features,
and integration with Supabase backend. Provides CRUD operations for
notebooks and manages sandbox/sharing functionality.

tags.title: example
param
tags.description: Owner of the notebook (user ID or 'public')
tags.name: owner

children.value: Owner of the notebook (user ID or 'public')
Python runtime service using Pyodide WebAssembly

Manages Python code execution in the browser via Pyodide. Handles package
installation, variable tracking, import suggestions, and provides a complete
Python environment without server dependencies.

tags.title: example

children.value:
Create a new PyodideService instance
Initializes the Python runtime manager with empty state
R statistical computing service using WebR WebAssembly

Provides R statistical computing capabilities in the browser via WebR.
Handles R code execution, package management, data analysis, and statistical
computations without requiring an R server.

tags.title: example

children.value:
Create a new WebRService instance
Initializes the R runtime manager with default state
Universal cell container with lifecycle management

A flexible cell component that can render different cell types (Python, R, Markdown)
through pluggable controllers. Handles cell execution, editing states, drag-and-drop
reordering, and provides consistent UI for all cell types.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
<!-- Python cell -->
<CodyxCell 
  controller={pythonController}
  cellId="cell-001"
  index={0}
  on:execute={handleExecute}
  on:delete={handleDelete}
/>

<!-- R cell with custom styling -->
<CodyxCell 
  controller={rController}
  cellId="cell-002" 
  index={1}
  focused={true}
  class="custom-cell-style"
/>

<!-- Markdown cell in edit mode -->
<CodyxCell 
  controller={markdownController}
  cellId="cell-003"
  index={2}
  initiallyEditing={true}
/>

tags.title: param
tags.description: Cell controller instance (Python, R, or Markdown)
tags.name: controller

tags.title: param
tags.description: Unique identifier for this cell instance
tags.name: cellId

tags.title: param
tags.description: Whether this cell has focus for keyboard navigation
tags.name: focused

tags.title: param
tags.description: Start the cell in editing mode
tags.name: initiallyEditing

tags.description: CodyxCell#execute - Fired when cell execution is requested

tags.title: fires

tags.title: fires

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxCell#moveDown - Fired when user requests to move cell down

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxCell#insertAbove - Fired when user requests new cell above

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxCell#insertBelow - Fired when user requests new cell below

The primary component that manages an entire Codyx notebook, including
cell creation, deletion, reordering, persistence, collaboration, and
integration with various runtime services (Python, R, Markdown).

tags.title: example
tags.description:
<!-- Basic notebook -->
<CodyxNotebook />

<!-- Notebook with specific slug -->
<CodyxNotebook slug="data-analysis-2024" />

<!-- Collaborative notebook -->
<CodyxNotebook 
  slug="team-project" 
  collaborative={true}
  userId="user-123"
/>

<!-- Import Jupyter notebook -->
<CodyxNotebook 
  importFile={jupyterFile}
  onImportComplete={(notebook) => console.log('Imported:', notebook)}
/>

tags.title: param
tags.description: Notebook identifier for persistence and collaboration
tags.name: slug

tags.title: param
tags.description: User identifier for collaboration and ownership
tags.name: userId

tags.title: param
tags.description: Run in sandbox mode (read-only, no persistence)
tags.name: sandboxMode

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxNotebook#notebookLoad - Fired when notebook is loaded from database

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxNotebook#notebookSave - Fired when notebook is saved to database

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxNotebook#cellAdd - Fired when a new cell is added to the notebook

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxNotebook#cellDelete - Fired when a cell is deleted from the notebook

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxNotebook#cellReorder - Fired when cells are reordered via drag-and-drop

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxNotebook#importComplete - Fired when Jupyter file import completes

tags.title: fires
tags.description: CodyxNotebook#collaborationSync - Fired when collaboration changes are synchronized

<!-- Basic notebook -->

<!-- Notebook with specific slug -->

<!-- Collaborative notebook -->
<CodyxNotebook 
  slug="team-project" 
  collaborative={true}
  userId="user-123"
/>

<!-- Import Jupyter notebook -->
<CodyxNotebook 
  importFile={jupyterFile}
  onImportComplete={(notebook) => console.log('Imported:', notebook)}
/>

Rich text editing interface with live preview

Specialized cell renderer for Markdown content with enhanced editing capabilities.
Provides live preview, edit/preview mode toggling, and integration with enhanced
markdown features for rich documentation and narrative text.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
<!-- Basic Markdown cell -->
<MarkdownCellRenderer 
  controller={markdownController}
  on:previewToggle={handlePreviewToggle}
/>

<!-- Markdown cell in preview mode -->
<MarkdownCellRenderer 
  controller={markdownController}
  initialPreview={true}
  enableMath={true}
/>

<!-- Markdown cell with enhanced features -->
<MarkdownCellRenderer 
  controller={markdownController}
  enableTables={true}
  enableCodeBlocks={true}
  enableMath={true}
/>

tags.title: param
tags.description: Whether cell is in edit mode (vs preview)
tags.name: editing

tags.title: param
tags.description: Start in preview mode instead of edit
tags.name: initialPreview

tags.title: fires
tags.description: MarkdownCellRenderer#previewToggle - Fired when edit/preview mode is toggled

tags.title: fires
tags.description: MarkdownCellRenderer#contentChange - Fired when markdown content changes

tags.title: fires
tags.description: MarkdownCellRenderer#linkClick - Fired when a link in preview is clicked

tags.title: fires
tags.description: MarkdownCellRenderer#imageLoad - Fired when an image in preview loads

tags.title: fires
tags.description: MarkdownCellRenderer#mathRender - Fired when math expressions are rendered

examples.description:
<!-- Basic Markdown cell -->
<MarkdownCellRenderer 
  controller={markdownController}
  on:previewToggle={handlePreviewToggle}
/>

<!-- Markdown cell in preview mode -->
<MarkdownCellRenderer 
  controller={markdownController}
  initialPreview={true}
  enableMath={true}
/>

<!-- Markdown cell with enhanced features -->
<MarkdownCellRenderer 
  controller={markdownController}
  enableTables={true}
  enableCodeBlocks={true}
  enableMath={true}
/>

children.value: Whether cell is in edit mode (vs preview)
Start in preview mode instead of edit
Python code execution interface with intelligent features

Specialized cell renderer for Python code with Pyodide integration. Provides
syntax highlighting, variable tracking, import suggestions, package installation,
and rich output display for plots, data tables, and execution results.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
<!-- Basic Python cell -->
<PythonCellRenderer 
  controller={pythonController}
  on:execute={handleExecution}
/>

<!-- Python cell with import suggestions -->
<PythonCellRenderer 
  controller={pythonController}
  showImportSuggestions={true}
  on:packageInstall={handlePackageInstall}
/>

<!-- Python cell with variable highlighting -->
<PythonCellRenderer 
  controller={pythonController}
  highlightVariables={true}
  variables={['df', 'plt', 'np']}
/>

tags.title: param
tags.description: Whether cell is in edit mode
tags.name: editing

tags.title: fires
tags.description: PythonCellRenderer#execute - Fired when Python code execution is triggered

tags.title: fires
tags.description: PythonCellRenderer#codeChange - Fired when code content changes

tags.title: fires
tags.description: PythonCellRenderer#packageInstall - Fired when package installation is requested

tags.title: fires
tags.description: PythonCellRenderer#importSuggestion - Fired when import suggestion is accepted

tags.title: fires
tags.description: PythonCellRenderer#variableClick - Fired when a highlighted variable is clicked

tags.title: fires
tags.description: PythonCellRenderer#outputToggle - Fired when output visibility is toggled

examples.description:
<!-- Basic Python cell -->
<PythonCellRenderer 
  controller={pythonController}
  on:execute={handleExecution}
/>

<!-- Python cell with import suggestions -->
<PythonCellRenderer 
  controller={pythonController}
  showImportSuggestions={true}
  on:packageInstall={handlePackageInstall}
/>

<!-- Python cell with variable highlighting -->
<PythonCellRenderer 
  controller={pythonController}
  highlightVariables={true}
  variables={['df', 'plt', 'np']}
/>

children.value: Whether cell is in edit mode
R statistical computing interface with WebR integration

Specialized cell renderer for R statistical computing with WebR runtime.
Provides R syntax highlighting, package management, statistical output
rendering, and integration with popular R libraries like ggplot2 and tidyverse.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
<!-- Basic R cell -->
<RCellRenderer 
  controller={rController}
  on:execute={handleExecution}
/>

<!-- R cell with package installation -->
<RCellRenderer 
  controller={rController}
  availablePackages={['ggplot2', 'dplyr', 'tidyr']}
  on:packageInstall={handleRPackageInstall}
/>

<!-- R cell with plot output -->
<RCellRenderer 
  controller={rController}
  showPlots={true}
  plotWidth={600}
  plotHeight={400}
/>

tags.title: param
tags.description: Whether cell is in edit mode
tags.name: editing

tags.title: fires
tags.description: RCellRenderer#execute - Fired when R code execution is triggered

tags.title: fires
tags.description: RCellRenderer#codeChange - Fired when R code content changes

tags.title: fires
tags.description: RCellRenderer#packageInstall - Fired when R package installation is requested

tags.title: fires
tags.description: RCellRenderer#plotGenerated - Fired when R generates a plot output

tags.title: fires
tags.description: RCellRenderer#dataFrameOutput - Fired when R outputs a data frame

tags.title: fires
tags.description: RCellRenderer#outputToggle - Fired when output visibility is toggled

examples.description:
